exec: *   (gets converted to UTF-8 for hashing); 'hex-bytes' for string of hex bytes ('616263' = 'abc') .
* @param   {string} [options.outFormat=hex] - Output format: 'hex' for string of contiguous
*   hex bytes; 'hex-w' for grouping hex bytes into groups of (4 byte / 8 character) words.
* @returns {string} Hash of msg as hex character string.
// note use throughout this routine of 'n >>> 0' to coerce Number 'n' to unsigned 32-bit integer
default: // default is to convert string to UTF-8, as SHA only deals with byte-streams
case 'hex-bytes': msg = hexBytesToString(msg); break; // mostly for running tests
msg += String.fromCharCode(0x80);  // add trailing '1' bit (+ 0's padding) to string [§5.1.1]
// convert string msg into 512-bit blocks (array of 16 32-bit integers) [§5.2.1]
const l = msg.length / 4 + 2; // length (in 32-bit integers) of msg + ‘1’ + appended length
const N = Math.ceil(l / 16);  // number of 16-integer (512-bit) blocks required to hold 'l' ints
const M = new Array(N);     // message M is N×16 array of 32-bit integers
for (let j = 0; j < 16; j++) { // encode 4 chars per integer (64 per block), big-endian encoding
} // note running off the end of msg is ok 'cos bitwise ops on NaN return 0
// add length (in bits) into final pair of 32-bit integers (big-endian) [§5.1.1]
// note: most significant word would be (len-1)*8 >>> 32, but since JS converts
// bitwise-op args to 32 bits, we need to simulate this by arithmetic operators
for (let t = 0; t < 16; t++) W[t] = M[i][t];
// 2 - initialise working variables a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h with previous hash value
const T1 = h + Sha256.S1(e) + Sha256.Ch(e, f, g) + K[t] + W[t];
const T2 = Sha256.S0(a) + Sha256.Maj(a, b, c);
// 4 - compute the new intermediate hash value (note '>>> 0' for 'addition modulo 2^32')
// convert H0..H7 to hex strings (with leading zeros)
for (let h = 0; h < H.length; h++) H[h] = ('00000000' + H[h].toString(16)).slice(-8);
// concatenate H0..H7, with separator if required
return new TextEncoder().encode(str, 'utf-8').reduce((prev, curr) => prev + String.fromCharCode(curr), '');
function hexBytesToString(hexStr) { // convert string of hex numbers to a string of chars (eg '616263' -> 'abc').
const str = hexStr.replace(' ', ''); // allow space-separated groups
* Rotates right (circular right shift) value x by n positions [§3.2.4].
static S0(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(2, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(13, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(22, x); }
static S1(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(6, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(11, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(25, x); }
static s0(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(7, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(18, x) ^ (x >>> 3); }
static s1(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(17, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(19, x) ^ (x >>> 10); }
static Ch(x, y, z) { return (x & y) ^ (~x & z); }          // 'choice'
static Maj(x, y, z) { return (x & y) ^ (x & z) ^ (y & z); } // 'majority'

static S0(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(2, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(13, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(22, x); }
static S1(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(6, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(11, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(25, x); }
static s0(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(7, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(18, x) ^ (x >>> 3); }
static s1(x) { return Sha256.ROTR(17, x) ^ Sha256.ROTR(19, x) ^ (x >>> 10); }

case 'hex-bytes': msg = hexBytesToString(msg); break; // mostly for running tests

// convert string msg into 512-bit blocks (array of 16 32-bit integers) [§5.2.1]

request.description:
Add money in wallet using payment gateway  
PGType:"atom" 
Only Form Post Allowed (Form Submit using html)  
You will get success response on responseURL for showing success dialog and reciepEndFragment

send otp before withdraw a money  
EndFragment

Withdraw money using BANKPAYOUT bank API  
please use following method for withdrawal  
"ModeOfPay": "IMPS" or "ModeOfPay": "NEFT"EndFragment

#### "to": "5000175534916339", //consumer TruID

"invoice": "17127502097416942415", OR  
"status": "success", OR "type": "buy" || "redeemCash" || "transfer" || "addMoney" || "walletToBank, OR

"MOP":"truWallet" or "others" // for bank  
"startdate": "2024-04-10T10:26:23.018Z"  
"enddate": "2024-04-16T10:26:23.018Z"  
"to" mandatory FieldsEndFragmentEndFragment
#### live rate from assetmanager

https://localhost:11122/api/topbuyerassetmanager
Listing Top 3 assetmanager for buying of the bullion which is in descending order
Buy by unit with multiple assetmanagers

request.description:
Redeem Cash & Coin Top assetmanager Rates
use flag
for cash "flag": "redeemCash"
redeem by cash with multiple assetmanagers

"MOP": "others", and accountNo & ModeOfPay for bank withdrawal

inprocess means request sent to bank
tpa : receiver Mobile Number / truID

http://localhost:11141/api/transferbullion
transfer bullion Customer to customer
#### recent transfer for consumers

#### StartFragment#### txn summary with optional Filter

"to": "5000175534916339", //consumer TruID  
"invoice": "17127502097416942415", OR  
"status": "success", OR "type": "buy", OR  
"rTruID": "" //partner TruID  
"MOP":"truWallet" or "others" // for bank

"startdate": "2024-04-10T10:26:23.018Z"  
"enddate": "2024-04-16T10:26:23.018Z"

"to" mandatory FieldsEndFragment
#### change Mpin for mobile devices

#### App Login via MPIN or password
 "mPIN": "123456" or "password": "Asdf@1234"

-->all bullion latest txn for a user
-->stock, walletbalance 
--> top 1 assetmanager rate for buuy and sale for all bullions
#### consumer configurations

item.description:
Company Client API of consumer. To generate a signature you need to request all the required parameters For example, if you want to pass the following name-value pairs in the request body. ``` { "CRNNo": "cAJ14E2Y", "clientID": "rKGC8N48", "transactionType": "buy", "status": "success", "MOP": "truWallet", "value": "5", "bullionType": "S99P", "invoice": "1631010019000", "otp":"123456" } ``` Then you need to sort all the parameters in ascending order and add the “Tilde” symbol as a separator. The Output will be as follows : **CRNNo=cAJ14E2Y\~MOP=truWallet\~bullionType=S99P\~clientID=rKGC8N48\~invoice=1631010019000\~otp=123456\~status=success\~transactionType=buy\~value=5** Next step is to append the Secret Key at the end of the parameter string given by Company you. After adding you will get the following output CRNNo=cAJ14E2Y\~MOP=truWallet\~bullionType=S99P\~clientID=rKGC8N48\~invoice=1631010019000\~otp=123456\~status=success\~transactionType=buy\~value=2**3462DE14A68E99AB3F1BFFF53763BF** Secret Key : **3462DE14A68E99AB3F1BFFF53763BF** After completing the above-mentioned process you will have to call SHA 256 algorithm and pass the parameter string to the same and the SHA will return you the desired result as below Signature = **9c616ff67d22c27c6e1b05401c076295360da65ac457428f403fa4b6ea5eb10d** ### Response Status code for API’s :

Status

Description

200

1000

Success

411

411

For all validations

401

401

Unauthorized Token !

500

500

Internal error

400

400

Bad Request !
